Understate: The claim may understate the progress made by President Trump in building a border wall by not acknowledging the replacement of existing barriers with steel bollard fencing.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or data to back up the assertion that President Trump hasn't built any new border wall.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the lack of a solid concrete wall means no progress has been made on the border wall project, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the replacement of existing barriers with steel bollard fencing can be considered as new wall construction, which contradicts the claim.
